title: Shri Baglamukhi – Official Puja & Anushthan Website
excerpt: Spiritual service platform for online puja booking and temple information.
description: Shri Baglamukhi is an official spiritual service website built to provide authentic information about Baglamukhi Puja, Anushthan, and temple services. The platform allows users to explore different puja offerings, read detailed descriptions, and connect directly for bookings and guidance. The project focuses on SEO optimization, performance, and scalable backend integration.
features: Dynamic Puja pages with SEO-friendly slugs
challenges: Major challenges included handling domain migration (.com and .in), fixing canonical URL issues, resolving duplicate indexing problems, setting up sitemap with backend integration, and managing DNS propagation with SSL configuration. Optimizing the site for SEO while maintaining performance on free hosting tiers also required careful planning.
learnings: This project strengthened my understanding of real-world deployment workflows, DNS configuration, SSL management, canonical tags, sitemap generation, and Google indexing behavior. I gained hands-on experience in full-stack deployment, production debugging, and SEO optimization for live client projects.

title: Sakhi
excerpt: Real-time chat app with authentication and online presence.
description: Sakhi is a full-stack real-time chatting application built with React and Node.js. It supports secure authentication, one-to-one messaging, online status tracking, and push notifications. The backend is powered by MongoDB with JWT-based authentication and optimized socket communication for real-time performance.
challenges: Through Sakhi, I gained strong hands-on experience with real-time application architecture. I learned how WebSocket-based communication works internally and how to integrate it effectively with REST APIs. The project strengthened my understanding of JWT-based authentication, protected routes, and secure data flow between frontend and backend. It also improved my skills in state management, asynchronous event handling, and designing scalable full-stack applications.
learnings: One of the main challenges in building Sakhi was implementing reliable real-time communication while ensuring secure authentication. Managing socket connections efficiently without memory leaks or duplicate listeners required careful event handling. Designing a clean and scalable backend structure using MongoDB, while maintaining user-specific message privacy, also required thoughtful schema planning. Additionally, synchronizing online/offline user status in real time without performance degradation was technically demanding.

title: TrueRate
excerpt: Minimal currency converter with instant API-based conversion.
description: TrueRate is a lightweight currency converter built as a weekend side project. It integrates with a live currency API to fetch real-time exchange rates and provides a clean, responsive UI for seamless currency conversion.
challenges: Handling asynchronous API calls and managing potential API failures or latency issues was a major challenge. Ensuring accurate currency formatting and instant UI updates without blocking user interaction required efficient state handling and error management.
learnings: This project improved my understanding of API integration and asynchronous programming. I learned how to manage external data sources, handle loading and error states properly, and ensure accurate real-time data presentation.

title: CricFair
excerpt: Offline cricket scoring and team management app.
description: CricFair is a React Native-based cricket scoring and team management app designed for local matches. It enables offline scoring, predictive player selection for fair play, and integrates with YouTube overlays for live score display during streaming.
challenges: Designing an offline-first architecture while maintaining accurate score tracking was a significant challenge. Managing complex match state transitions and player logic required structured state management. Integrating live overlay support for streaming platforms added additional technical complexity.
learnings: This project strengthened my knowledge of offline-first architecture and mobile state management using React Native. I learned how to manage complex match logic, maintain consistency in offline mode, and design scalable mobile application structures.

title: KaranSharmaXP
description: KaranSharmaXP is a nostalgic, Windows XP-inspired portfolio experience that recreates the classic desktop environment in the browser. It includes draggable windows, icon-based navigation, and interactive UI elements built entirely using modern React architecture.
challenges: Recreating a desktop-like window management system inside the browser was technically challenging. Implementing draggable windows, dynamic z-index control, and window focus handling required advanced state coordination. Ensuring responsiveness while maintaining the authenticity of a Windows XP-style UI added another layer of complexity.
learnings: This project enhanced my ability to manage complex UI states and dynamic layouts. I learned how to implement draggable components, manage z-index layering, and recreate desktop-like interactions inside a modern web application using React.

title: Wonders of World
excerpt: Interactive animated showcase of world wonders.
description: Wonders of the World is an interactive visual showcase that brings iconic global landmarks to life using dynamic slice-based animations. Each section animates smoothly on entry and reveals contextual information about the wonder, blending motion design with educational storytelling.
challenges: Creating smooth slice-based animations that synchronize correctly with content reveal required careful timing and animation logic. Maintaining performance on lower-end devices while using visually rich transitions was another challenge. Designing responsive animated layouts without breaking visual consistency demanded thoughtful UI structuring.
learnings: I learned how to combine animation techniques with storytelling to enhance user engagement. This project improved my understanding of timing-based animations, performance optimization for motion-heavy components, and responsive animation design.

title: CropMateAI
description: CropMateAI is an AI-based system that predicts optimal crop harvest time by analyzing climatic and soil conditions. Built using Python and Scikit-learn for model training, and Flask for backend API integration, the system helps farmers make data-driven decisions.
challenges: Preparing and cleaning the dataset before training the machine learning model required careful preprocessing. Selecting an appropriate algorithm and tuning it for accurate predictions was technically demanding. Integrating the Python ML backend with a React frontend through a Flask API while managing response timing was another key challenge.
learnings: Working on this AI-based system deepened my understanding of data preprocessing, model training, and backend integration. I learned how to bridge machine learning models with web applications and handle real-world prediction workflows.

title: Do You Love Me? – Interactive Playful UI Experiment
excerpt: A playful interactive UI where the ‘No’ button refuses to be clicked.
description: ‘Do You Love Me?’ is a lighthearted interactive UI experiment designed to demonstrate creative event handling and dynamic positioning in the browser. The interface presents two options — Yes and No — but when users attempt to click the No button, it dynamically repositions itself, creating a playful and engaging experience. The project focuses on DOM manipulation, mouse event tracking, collision logic, and responsive button movement behavior.
challenges: The main challenge was preventing the 'No' button from moving outside the viewport while ensuring smooth repositioning without visual glitches. Managing mouse proximity detection and preventing accidental overlaps required careful coordinate calculations.
learnings: This project helped strengthen my understanding of DOM manipulation, event listeners, viewport calculations, and creative UI behavior design. It reinforced how small interactive elements can significantly enhance user engagement.

title: Threadly
excerpt: Minimal social platform for creating and exploring posts.
description: Threadly is a full-stack social platform where users can sign up, create posts, explore public content, and interact with others. The backend is built using Spring Boot and MongoDB, while the frontend uses React for a smooth and responsive user experience.
challenges: Designing a clean API architecture using Spring Boot while integrating it seamlessly with a React frontend was a key challenge. Managing authentication securely and structuring MongoDB schemas effectively required careful backend planning. Keeping frontend and backend data models synchronized also required disciplined development.
learnings: Through Threadly, I strengthened my full-stack development skills. I learned how to design RESTful APIs using Spring Boot, structure MongoDB schemas effectively, and integrate frontend and backend systems while maintaining clean data flow and authentication handling.

title: PhotoBooth
excerpt: Web-based camera app with filters and collage creation.
description: PhotoBooth is a web-based camera application built using React that allows users to capture photos directly from their device camera. Users can apply visual filters, create collages, preview their compositions, and download final images — all in the browser without external tools.
challenges: Accessing and managing camera permissions across browsers was one of the main challenges. Applying real-time filters using the Canvas API while maintaining performance required careful optimization. Generating downloadable images and handling collage composition logic without quality loss also demanded precise image manipulation handling.
learnings: I gained practical experience working with browser APIs, particularly the Camera API and Canvas API. The project improved my understanding of image manipulation, real-time rendering, and handling media permissions securely in web applications.

title: Portfolio Website
excerpt: Modern personal portfolio showcasing projects and skills.
description: A modern and responsive portfolio website built to showcase my technical skills, featured projects, and professional journey. The design focuses on clean layout, smooth user experience, and structured content presentation to effectively communicate expertise and creativity.
challenges: Structuring the application to remain scalable while maintaining consistent design patterns was a major focus. Ensuring performance optimization for faster load times and creating a clean visual hierarchy to present projects effectively required deliberate UI/UX decisions.
learnings: Building my portfolio improved my UI/UX thinking and design consistency. I learned how to structure content for clarity, optimize performance, and present projects strategically to communicate technical depth effectively

title: Drawing App
description: Drawing App is a browser-based digital art tool built using vanilla JavaScript and the HTML Canvas API. It allows users to sketch, adjust brush sizes, choose colors, and create digital artwork interactively. The project explores canvas rendering, mouse event handling, and responsive layout design.
challenges: One of the main challenges was implementing smooth drawing behavior while maintaining performance across different screen sizes. Handling mouse and touch events consistently required careful event management, and resizing the canvas without losing existing drawings required thoughtful state handling. Ensuring responsive behavior while preserving drawing accuracy was also a key technical focus.
learnings: Through this project, I gained a deeper understanding of the HTML Canvas API and how rendering works in the browser. I learned how to manage drawing logic efficiently, handle user interaction events properly, and maintain performance during continuous rendering operations. It strengthened my understanding of event handling and responsive UI behavior.

title: Paint Tool
excerpt: Responsive browser-based paint tool built with canvas.
description: Paint Tool is a lightweight drawing application built using React and the HTML Canvas API. It enables users to draw freely on the screen with responsive behavior across different device sizes. The project focuses on understanding canvas rendering, event handling, and dynamic UI responsiveness in modern web applications.
challenges: One of the main challenges was implementing smooth drawing behavior while maintaining performance across different screen sizes. Handling mouse and touch events consistently required careful event management, and resizing the canvas without losing existing drawings required thoughtful state handling. Ensuring responsive behavior while preserving drawing accuracy was also a key technical focus.
learnings: Through this project, I gained a deeper understanding of the HTML Canvas API and how rendering works in the browser. I learned how to manage drawing logic efficiently, handle user interaction events properly, and maintain performance during continuous rendering operations. It strengthened my understanding of event handling and responsive UI behavior.

title: Tic-Tac-Toe
excerpt: Classic 2-player game built with vanilla JavaScript.
description: Tic-Tac-Toe is a browser-based 2-player strategy game built using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. It demonstrates DOM manipulation, state management logic, and event-driven programming without external frameworks.
challenges: The primary challenge was designing a clean and reliable win-detection algorithm while preventing invalid moves. Managing game state transitions correctly without introducing unnecessary complexity was important, especially since the app was built using vanilla JavaScript without a framework. Keeping the logic simple yet maintainable required careful structuring.
learnings: This project improved my understanding of state management and logical problem solving using vanilla JavaScript. I learned how to structure clean game logic, implement win-detection algorithms, and manage DOM updates efficiently without relying on frameworks.

title: Todo App
excerpt: Task management app with CRUD functionality.
description: Todo App is a simple task management application built using React. It allows users to create, edit, delete, and manage tasks efficiently. The project demonstrates component-based architecture, state management, and user interaction handling in React.
challenges: The challenge was managing component state efficiently while keeping the UI responsive and scalable. Handling controlled inputs and ensuring consistent updates without unnecessary re-renders required proper React state management practices. Structuring the application in a way that allows easy future extension was also a consideration
learnings: Building this app reinforced core React fundamentals such as component architecture, state management, and controlled inputs. I learned how to design reusable components and structure applications in a scalable way while keeping the UI responsive and clean.
